go under.translation[0].definitions[0].d: if a business goes under, it has to stop operating because of financial problems
go under.translation[0].definitions[0].e: More than 7,000 businesses have gone under in the last three months.
go under.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to sink beneath the surface of water
go under.translation[0].definitions[1].e: She went under, coughing and spluttering.
go under.translation[1].definitions[0].d: if a business goes under, it fails because of financial difficulties
go under.translation[1].definitions[0].e: As their smaller competitors go under, the large home-building companies grab more and more of the market.
